comments:
Embeds existing Plotly figure in IPython Notebook

Plotly uniquely identifies figures with a 'file_owner'/'file_id' pair. Since each file is given a corresponding unique url, you may also simply pass a valid plotly url as the first argument.

Note, if you're using a file_owner string as the first argument, you MUST specify a `file_id` keyword argument. Else, if you're using a url string as the first argument, you MUST NOT specify a `file_id` keyword argument, or file_id must be set to Python's None value.

Positional arguments: file_owner_or_url (string) -- a valid plotly username OR a valid plotly url

Keyword arguments: file_id (default=None) -- an int or string that can be converted to int if you're using a url, don't fill this in! width (default="100%") -- an int or string corresp. to width of the figure height (default="525") -- same as width but corresp. to the height of the figure
